br.uff.midiacom.ana.link

public class NCLBind<T extends NCLElement,Er extends NCLRoleElement,En extends NCLNode,Ei extends NCLInterface,El extends NCLLayoutDescriptor,Ep extends NCLBindParam,R extends ExternalReferenceType>
extends NCLElementPrototype<T>
implements NCLElement<T>

Class that represents a bind element. A bind associates a role defined in a connector to a node.
This element defines the attributes:

  • role - role defined in a connector. This attribute is required.
  • component - node to be associated to the role. This attribute is required.
  • interface - node interface point to be associated to the role. This attribute is optional.
  • descriptor - descriptor to be used by the node. This attribute is optional.

This element has as children the elements:
  • bindParam - element that defines a value to a parameter defined in the connector. The bind can have none or several parameter elements.

setRole

public void setRole(Er role)
             throws XMLException
Sets the role defined in a connector used by the bind. This attribute is required and can not be set to null.
The role referred must be a role defined by the connector used by the link parent of the bind element.

Parameters:
role - element representing a reference to a role element.
Throws:
XMLException - if the role is null or any error occur while creating the reference to the role.

element representing a reference to a role element or null if the attribute is not defined.

setInterface

public void setInterface(Ei interfac)
                  throws XMLException

The interface referred must be a interface point of the node referred by the component attribute.

Parameters:
interfac - element representing a reference to a interface element or null to erase a interface already defined.

setDescriptor

public void setDescriptor(java.lang.Object descriptor)
                   throws XMLException
Sets the descriptor that describes the node presentation. This attribute is optional. Set the descriptor to null to erase a descriptor already defined.
The descriptor referred can be defined in the document base of descriptors or in a base defined in an external document, imported by the base of descriptors or by the base of imported documents. When the descriptor is defined in an external document, the alias of the imported document must be indicated in the reference.

Parameters:
descriptor - element representing a descriptor or a reference to a descriptor or null to erase a descriptor already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if any error occur while creating the reference to the descriptor.

getDescriptor

public java.lang.Object getDescriptor()
Returns the descriptor that describes the node presentation or null is the attribute is not defined.
The descriptor referred can be defined in the document base of descriptors or in a base defined in an external document, imported by the base of descriptors or by the base of imported documents. When the descriptor is defined in an external document, the alias of the imported document must be indicated in the reference.

Returns:
element representing a descriptor or a reference to a descriptor or null if the attribute is not defined.
